main event: Three military pilots in Dereham, Norfolk, England, reported observing a uniform flying object on 4/2/54 at 9:30 AM, which was concluded to be a balloon based on the description, flight maneuvers, and radar pickups.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of 20,000 to 30,000 ft, made a 180-degree turn, and displayed a speed of 2,000 to 3,000 MPH.
The report indicated a clear weather and good visibility, and the object was considered impossible for a conventional balloon.
Captain Gamett, a Quartermaster Corps officer, reported sighting a disc-shaped object emitting a greenish-blue glow and performing erratic maneuvers before disappearing at high speed on 10 May 1954.
The sighting by Captain Gamett was considered of interest and merits further investigation based on his credibility as a witness.
Another report described three light-colored elliptical objects, highly reflective and presenting in silhouette, observed by four witnesses near Downham Market, Norfolk, England, at 3:15 PM.
sighted object: uniform flying object; disc-shaped object emitting a greenish-blue glow; three light-colored elliptical objects
location: Dereham, Norfolk, England; Downham Market, Norfolk, England
witnesses: three military pilots; Captain Gamett, a Quartermaster Corps officer; four witnesses
